1111.content:
It was after the fall of the Red Flame Dragon. The boss of level seventy had been a peeling burn for over an hour, with its own regenerative powers in the lava pits. No lives had been lost, but it had cost a plethora of healing potions.

Kirito had not dealt the killing blow, so he volunteered to activate the next level’s portal. Joined by a few others, they ascended the pumice stone staircase that had fallen into one of the lava pools.

Once they reached the top flight of stairs, Kirito fell behind the others while opening his inventory. Upon realizing he had no more healing potions, he pulled out some food parcels to heal his health-even a little.

“Please … help.” Kirito looked around. The group was already on the hilltop, out of calling distance; he snapped to a defensive position, looking for the distress call. A bush rustled, and a maimed AI character crawled out onto the village path. Kirito rushed over, and checked the man. The man was fatally wounded, with a dropping health bar. Kirito was surprised; most AI characters were Immortal, unable to die. “My daughter! She is trapped out in the swamp. If you are willing, take this. Aid her!” A blue gemmed pendant dropped out of a clenched fist.

Kirito picked it up, and accepted the challenge, “I will help her. Hold on.” Kirito tried to feed some jerky to the man. The man nibbled, and the bar stalled. “Where is she? How do I help her?”

The man groaned, “The Malady Swamp is to the east. The sunken boulders will point you towards her. The pendant will help her.” A sigh escaped his lips as the health meter finally emptied. The man burst into a pile of blue data shards.

Kirito zoned out, until a notification pinged on his screen. It read, ‘New objective added. New Item added: Goul Syrup Pendant.’ Kirito shook himself out of his daze. He slipped it onto his neck as he started to jog towards the eastern marsh swamps, determined to save the girl.

Kirito found the Malady Swamp easily. He followed the sunken boulders with a little difficulty. The early afternoon sun shone on his back as he followed his shadow deeper into the swamp. Looking at the ruined bog in front of him, Kirito realized he had no idea what to do next.

The bog was covered in a layer of algae, hiding the open water and the mud holes from the safe rock trails. Torches illuminated the area, indicating an enemy intelligence inhabited the bog. An island of flowers blossomed in the distant center. A body lay still, possibly sleeping at the crown of the island. Looming over the petite body was a massive carnivorous plant. It looked like a Venus Fly Trap, with a bluish hue on the outer hinged parts, and a stem of watermelon red.

Wary of alerting enemy monsters, Kirito called out, “Hey there? Are you awake? I’m here to help you.”

The petite body stirred; a child in a torn dress with lots of grass stains stood. Seeing Kirito, she sank low and tried to crawl down the hill. A frenzied rustling of fabric and flora reached Kirito’s sensitive ears.

Sudden bursts of flowers and vines covered the island. When the petals settled, the girl was bound in vines. Kirito tried to start across the swamp, but a tiny high voice amplified across the swamp, “Stop, you’ll sink!” Kirito looked closer; the girl was holding a pure white flower to her lips. “Find a white vocal flower. It will help you talk to me without waking the ghouls or vine plants.”

Following the AI’s instruction, Kirito scoured the bog’s boundary for such a flower. Pulling a small, white flower, Kirito whispered, “Is this the flower?”

“Yes. The roots of these flowers are hollow and wiry with a long stretching stem. It allows for vocal messages, provided they’re in the ground to allow vibrations. How did you find me?”

“Your father sent me to find you.” Kirito was not sure if the cyber girl was aware of the loss of her father. If not, she did not need to kill herself with frantic struggles. “I want to help you. If I could cross the swamp, I would cut you loose from the vines and carry you out. Can you tell me if there is anybody around here?”

The little girl spoke into the flower in hushed tones, “The ghouls roam more towards sunset. If you add me to your party list, I can help navigate you to this island. Do you trust me?”

An invite appeared in front of Kirito. Skimming the generic script of the message window, he accepted the invite from Amelia Grace. Amelia’s health bar popped down under Kirito’s; the girl’s life was not dropping, but it was much larger than Kirito expected for an AI child character. Holding the white flower up to his mouth, he asked, “I trust that you know what you are doing. Now, how do I get to you?”

Amelia responded, “You can’t get to me, but I have a plan. Did my father give you a pendant? If you don’t have it, you can’t help me.”

Kirito responded, “Yes, I’m wearing it. But how can you do anything when you’re tied up? How does this pendant help me help you?”

Amelia’s hands wiggled through her vine bonds and reached to her neck. She pulled out a flower like the ones around his feet. “Keep wearing the pendant and stand very still,” Amelia breathed steadily.

Kirito observed a small thin item slip out of her sleeve and into the new flower. Suddenly, a stabbing sensation blossomed in Kirito’s neck. He dropped to his knees and the screen darkened. Just as suddenly, the screen brightened to normal levels. Kirito checked his screen. Everything looked normal, but Amelia Grace’s health bar showed her as paralyzed now.

When Kirito tried to call out to her, there was no audio signal. His hands rose up, and clenched and flexed by themselves. His arm rose to his neck and pulled out a needle-thin blade from the back of his neck.

“You can relax for the moment, Mr. Kirito.” It was Kirito’s own voice, but he had not said anything. “If you want to talk, call up the message box.”

Kirito typed, ‘What did you do?’ He tried to move his arms and legs, but the program seemed to deny his actions.

“It’s Amelia. I used my pendant to hack your character. This needle is laced with doping nectar, producing body manipulation. I can control you to rescue me.”

Kirito typed furiously, ‘I could have come to you, while you spoke directions into the flower. You don’t have to steal my body.’

Amelia spoke again in Kirito’s voice, “That won’t work. Vocal flowers don’t work in water, and there are too many dangers in this swamp for swift responses. Relax, the possession process leaves no physical harm.”

Kirito fumed. He typed, ‘You could ask first.’ Lazily, Kirito’s arm pulled up the menu, and flipped through the inventory lists. Amelia changed his combat boots out for some simple sneakers and put away his Midnight Cloak. ‘Now what are you doing?’

Amelia explained, “I can control your inventory. Right now, I am accessorizing to make you light enough for the swamp; the alga drags anything that touches it underwater. Hey—why do you have two swords?”

Kirito banged out a harsh response, ‘THAT’S NONE OF YOUR BEESWAX! NOW GET THIS OVER WITH!’

“Fine. Watch and learn, human player.”

Amelia stood up and stretched Kirito’s legs, and paused for effect. She launched Kirito to the first boulder. Surprisingly, Kirito observed his body had a new grace and fluidity as Amelia piloted his body through a complex maze of sunken islands and marshy passages. No monsters appeared, but the setting sun put some pep into her step. Finally, Kirito’s body was just short of the center island.

“Okay, now for the monster slaying part,” Amelia whispered as she opened the weapon’s inventory. “I would have liked more throwing knives, but this will do, to get in close enough.”

Kirito scowled in his void. ‘Excuse me, but I just finished a boss fight. No time to resupply before I got swept into this rescue quest.’

Amelia equipped the white sword and a fistful of throwing spikes. She squatted down in Kirito’s body and dipped the spikes in the algae. The spikes suddenly took on a new poison ability. She noted, “The algae does have a toxic reaction to metal. Another reason to be light on your feet here. Now, I will either pin down or poison the vines, and then cut my body loose. Hopefully, I won’t have to cut the plant down.”

‘Whoa, why not? This thing could kill you and me!’ Kirito typed.

Amelia whispered, “The plant produces the alga that contains the ghouls to just the Malady Swamp. Otherwise, the whole level would be overrun.”

Kirito acknowledged, ‘Ok, level apocalypse would be nice to avoid. Keep it up, and let’s get out of this bog.’

Amelia armed and launched four shots. She marched onto the island and up to her own unconscious body. The blue Fly Trap was paralyzed, the tentacles flipping all over the island. Kirito’s sword arm swung the white blade; Amelia’s body slumped into the flowers. Sheathing the sword, Kirito’s body lifted the unconscious Amelia and slipped down the slope.

Kirito watched in awe as Amelia danced across the swamp with two bodies to balance. He even wondered if his own player skill could pull off such a feat. When Amelia reached the bog’s edge, Kirito suddenly felt a heavy weight on his shoulders. He was back in control.

Amelia’s petite body started heaving breaths. She wheezed, “Your turn, Kirito. Go out the way you came in.”
1111.title: A possessive spirit controls the Dual Wielder

choices: Show off new power to Kline
Take Asuna for a whirl on the town
11111.content:
Kirito flipped open his inventory. Other than the upgraded poison spikes, everything was as he had left it. Changing the sneakers back for combat boots, he hoisted Amelia back onto his upper back.

He started onto the trail of boulders leading out of the swamp. Amelia Grace wrapped her arms around his neck and he carried her piggy back.

The sunset cast their shadows behind them and that was quite convenient. It allowed for Kirito to see the four ghouls patrolling Malady Swamp’s only exit before they noticed him.

Kirito squatted down and asked Amelia, “Do you think you can stay here while I beat those ghouls away? I can’t fight them and protect you at the same time.”

“Well, don’t. Protect me, and I’ll fight them.” Amelia pushed herself free of Kirito and looked at the ghouls. A small needle blade appeared from her sleeve and she threw it through the air. When the needle pierced one of the ghoul’s neck, Amelia crumpled, falling towards the swamp algae.

Kirito grabbed her. Pulling her towards relative safety, he looked over his shoulder towards the patrol. One of the ghouls put a thumbs-up into the air. Kirito looked down at Amelia; her body was unconscious and paralyzed. He looked up again just as Amelia the ghoul struck.

The other ghouls never stood a chance; their programming prevented them from attacking one of their own. Ordinarily slow and ignorant, Amelia the ghoul was swift and calculating. She tore the arms off the first monster. Using one dismembered arm as a baseball bat, Amelia attacked the head of the second ghoul. The two broken ghoul bodies burst into blue shards, and the missing body parts burst into blue fireworks. She grabbed the third enemy ghoul and spun the creature to face her. When the creature fell away, Kirito noticed a cavity in the chest just before it disintegrated into data shards.

Amelia the ghoul waved him over. Picking up Amelia’s unconscious human body, Kirito closed the distance from their hiding spot to where the entrance to the swamp was. The only obstacle left was Amelia’s ghoul body.

When he came in striking distance, Amelia raised her arms in surrender. Amelia growled at Kirito, and moved a finger in a slashing motion across her ghoulish throat. Kirito asked, “What, you want me to attack you?” The ghoul nodded, and made a self-stabbing gesture to the heart.

Kirito pulled out his white sword and held it out. He wasn’t sure how this would work. Amelia the ghoul just rushed him and impaled her false body. As the ghoul disintegrated, Amelia’s body woke up and watched the fallen monster.

Amelia wheezed, “Don’t dawdle. Let’s get out of here before more generate.”

Kirito exclaimed, “Hold on! Are you ok? My sword just stabbed the body you inhabited, but you just sound exhausted, not wounded.”

Amelia heaved a sigh and answered, “Yes, there is just exhaustion from the possession process. If a body suffers fatal damage, my spirit returns to my body.”

Kirito nodded, and started to carry Amelia out of the swamp. Crossing the boundary lines, he was struck by a horrifying thought. “Wait one minute, girl. That means if you had failed in the bog crossing to the island, I would have drowned, and you would revert to your body! Of all the lowlife dirty—” Kirito screamed at Amelia and dropped her to the safe dirt path.

Amelia Grace landed hard on the path. She exclaimed, “Ow! Alright, you could have died, but I have roamed that swamp all my life. If you want, I can reward you for your extra troubles. You did accept my father’s quest after all.”

Kirito glared at the little girl. He knelt down, and answered, “Ok, fine. I’ll accept your reward.”

Amelia Grace pointed at the pendant hanging from Kirito’s neck. “First, I need my pendant back.”

Kirito activated the inventory sale menu, and pushed the ‘Goul Syrup Pendant’ into the sale column. In Amelia Grace’s side of the menu, three lines of stars appeared. Curious, Kirito accepted the sale.

Amelia grasped the pendant in her hands. “Thank you, Sir Kirito.” She leaned in and kissed him on the cheek. “I have to get home now; Daddy should be cooking dinner. Bye!” In a blur of flowers, she was gone, a shrinking speck heading to the false safety of her home—with her father gone since the quest started.

Kirito started to go after her, but a notification flashed in his face. The announcement box read, ‘Quest Complete! +XP 10,000 +Gold 500 New skill Received!’ Intrigued, he read the new skill.
&*&
Possessive Lunge
• Can only be used in dungeons or city limits
• When activated, USER becomes paralyzed and Immortal Object. When deactivated, USER remains paralyzed for 15 seconds.
• If used on AI character-monster or human-USER gains access to body movement and any weapons or inventory. Inventory can be dropped or exchanged to others.
• If used on Humans-green, orange or red players-USER gains access to body movement, all unlocked skills, and all inventory. Inventory can be adjusted, but NOT sold or discarded. Upon leaving body, original player will gain control, with complete awareness of all events.
• During possession, original player can communicate via type messages. USER vocal responses are altered to their voice.
• There are two upgrades with hidden requirements to unlock: ‘Dark Takeover’ and ‘Split Spirits’.
• To activate:
1. Enter town or dungeon.
2. Equip sword, dagger or throwing knives.
3. Tap skill to enchant weapon.
4. Attack target and hit with neck/ head-shot.

Kirito mulled over what to do next…

11112.content:
Kirito asked Amelia Grace, “Are you ok?”

Amelia responded, “Yeah, the body possession process paralyzes the user for a bit. Just carry me, and I’ll take a breather.”

Kirito flipped open his inventory. All his supplies were there, including the improved poison spikes. Taking a second, he dipped several mason jars into the algae, collecting samples for Asuna, Kline, and Lisbeth. If there was a way to blend the algae to other metals to create poison weapons, he wanted to pioneer it.

Kirito rearmed his black sword and combat boots before throwing Amelia’s body over his shoulder. With a running leap, he hopped back down the boulder trail to the edge of the swamp.

Amelia had recovered her full movement ability in about 5 minutes. They reached a sandy arena, an off-branch that Kirito had missed on his way into the swamp. Kirito let Amelia down, and they stretched for a bit.

Suddenly, ghouls appeared on the far edge of the arena clearing. There were fourteen ghouls coming towards them from the far side. Kirito swung to the entrance, and almost bit his tongue. Six more had risen from the swamp and blocked the boulder trail out of the swamp.

Kirito quickly armed his two swords. “I really don’t want to fight these creeps; I’ll advance on one group, and the other side will rush and kill you and overwhelm me. Tell me, can you stick close while I fight?”

Amelia Grace glared, “Uh-uh! I have a better plan. Just defend me, and I will resolve this. Can I trust you?” Before Kirito responded in either agreement or disagreement, Amelia threw a needle out towards the ghouls. Amelia dropped to the sandy ground.

Kirito dropped to a knee so he could check Amelia’s symptoms. Her body registered as paralyzed, and she was unresponsive to his touch. Before he could check her body further, a moaning roar caught his attention.

The mob of ghouls was rushing towards him. He braced himself; there would be no repeat of the ‘Moonlit Black Cats guild disaster’. He lopped off the arms of the first ghoul to reach him, and stabbed another monster through on each blade. Pulling his blades free, he counted his frontal enemies at nine monsters.

Wait, what? Kirito double-checked his mental math. Fourteen with three stabbed was eleven, not eight. Wait— only eight now?

Then he saw the solution. He witnessed a ghoul suddenly swipe its claws out against the rest of the frontal assault group. The group turned towards their fallen comrade, but only saw another ghoul. Their programming prevented them from tagging one of their own as a traitor; it never occurred before. With Amelia Grace’s possession power, she could turn the enemy into a puppet assassin.

Kirito watched in fascination. The ghoul rebel, possessed by Amelia, pointed behind Kirito in jerky movements. Spinning around, Kirito realized he had his own fight to worry about. The six ghouls guarding the exit had joined the fray, just as he had feared. He launched himself into their midst. Before they could figure out what to do, four were bursting into sprays of blue shards, with a fifth covered in red slash marks; Kirito had stabbed two blades into the skull of the last ghoul monster. As the last two baddies disintegrated into data shards, Kirito turned to check on Amelia.

Amelia was fighting two ghouls, forcing them to turn about in circles. The third and last monster was almost on top of her unconscious body, aiming its slobbering maw for her face. Amelia was unable to see this development, with her back turned, and her clawing hands otherwise occupied.

Kirito was too far away for his sword moves. Struggling with his throwing knives satchel, he watched Amelia’s body in horror.

The maw of the ghoul reached down. The jaw closed on Amelia’s neck. There was a blinding flash and the ghoul was still hunched over her body. An icon flashed above her unconscious body: Immortal Object.

Before the ghoul could try again, a poisonous stake was jutting out of its slobbering mouth. It stood, jerking its limbs as Kirito marched over and decapitated it. In a second swing, he brought the sword down on Amelia to the same result: a flash of light and the Immortal Object icon. He marched over to the ghoul possessed by Amelia and jabbed it through the gut.

“Ow, Kirito. What’s the matter?”

Kirito whirled on Amelia, leaving the ghoul body to disappear. He yelled, “You’re Immortal? When were you going to tell me?”

Amelia flinched, but her body was still paralyzed. She whimpered, “Only during the possession period. Some smart monsters realized they could still pick me up, even when I am Immortal. After I release the body, or the host body is killed, I return, lose the invincibility, and stay paralyzed for a while. That window allows monsters to kill me.” Some digital tears had rolled down. “I didn’t know how to tell you. That’s how I got so deep in the swamp. Now, I’m tired; I’m thirsty and hungry; I wanna see my daddy.”

Kirito felt bad for blowing up at a child AI character. He lowered himself and patted Amelia’s cheek. He apologized, “I’m sorry I yelled. I thought I’d lost you. C’mon, let’s get you home.” He lifted her petite body into his arms. “One more question: Where is your home?”

When they had cleared Malady Swamp’s borders, Kirito set her down feet-first. On the dirt trail through the woods, the two simply talked about the woods, Kirito’s feats, and Amelia’s misadventures.

Arriving at the cabin, Amelia stepped onto the log porch and turned to face Kirito. Smiling, she said, “Thank you for escorting me home. Also thanks for being honest about my daddy, Sir Kirito.”

Kirito nodded, “Happy to help. Listen, do you want me to come and visit? I think my friends would like to meet someone like you.”

“No, I’m mostly a loner. I don’t do well with anybody, but my dad.” She stopped and sniffled. Looking up, something caught her eye. “Hey, Kirito, can I have one last thing? That necklace is special, and I would like it to remember my daddy … and you.”

Kirito nodded, and took the necklace off his neck. He handed it to Amelia Grace, who clasped it to her chest. She leaned in, and kissed Kirito’s cheek. Waving good-bye, she slipped inside the log cabin.

Kirito turned away from the cabin. He was about to start back into Village Seventy-One when an Award Notification appeared. It read, ‘Quest Complete! +XP 10,000. +Gold 500. New Skill Received! Skill powers below…’
&*&

12321.content:
Sword Art Online it is! Before we can truly begin, pick a scenario for our dear heroine...

S-Class Ingredient Hunting


Despite having trapped ten thousand people, Sword Art Online is still an game. And, as part of its original programming, in-game events occur weekly.

One of these, S-Class Madness, catches the eye of Asuna, who begins hunting down as many rare creatures as she possibly can and creating divine dishes with them. However, she doesn't realise the effect the rare ingredients begin to have on her waistline...

The Cornucopia of Plenty


As a reward for a rather simple quest, Asuna receives an odd horn with the ability to create food from nothing. Intrigued, she tries a bit only to find that she has trouble eating anything not created by the horn. And even then, she just can't get enough of its delicious treats...
12321.title: Sword Art Online

123211.content:
"Attention, players. This is an update on this week's in-game event..."

Asuna, who had been in the middle of shopping, paused. While she never really cared for the events the game chose for them, occasionally she would take part in them. But only if it benefited her in some way, like extra gold drops or EXP gains. Not if her only reward was satisfaction.

"This week, the spawn rate of all rare S-Class creatures has been increased exponentially. Additionally, all rare drops from a S-Class creature have a higher rate of dropping".

Asuna's eyes went wide. The chances of a S-Class creature spawning normally were incredibly low, and for good reason. For those that enjoyed cooking, they dropped the best ingredients that gave the best XP gains. In her whole time cooking, she had only ever cooked one and it had been the best meal she had had since being imprisoned here.

Pulling up the in-game menu, Asuna quickly equipped her combat gear. Her yellow sweater and brown skirt faded away in a bright light, revealing a pristine white outfit with red crosses patterned over it. Making sure her rapier was at her side, she headed for the teleport gate, ready for a full day of non-stop hunting...

=====


"Hiyah!"

The tiny rabbit before her let out a squeal as her rapier, glowing with a blue light, cut into its neck. It twitched briefly before exploding into blue particles. In its place, a slab of red meat and a light brown hide appeared. Stooping down, Asuna pulled them into her inventory before straightening up and signing.

"I've been at this for hours..." She mumbled under her breath. "I think I've got a half-decent haul. Let's have a look..."

Opening her inventory, Asuna whistled. Sitting in her inventory were ten whole hunks of Rag-Out Rabbit, the S-Class creature for the floor she was on. Aside from that, she had a few hides, which could be applied to leather armour to significantly improve its defence.

"Think that should do me for now!" She said happily, pulling a Teleport Crystal out of her pocket. Before she teleported, her eyes flitted up to her health bar. Hers was full, however below it was one with a little missing from it. As she watched, a good chunk of it vanished, only to be replaced a moment later.

Should I invite him? Asuna wondered. Nah, not this time. This time, I did all the work, therefore I get all the rewards!

With that decided, Asuna held her Crystal up and teleported back to her home...

=====


Changing into her cooking attire, which was an apron over a t-shirt an pair of shorts, Asuna dropped the days haul onto the counter before her. Ten shining hunks of delicious, juicy meat... She had so many plans for what she could do with these!

Within minutes, each one had been chopped up and assigned to a different dish. She was easily cooking enough to feed her for a week, maybe even two, but that didn't bother her. If she really wanted, she could eat it all today with no consequences. After all, in VR, you never got full and you never put on weight. It was part of the reason Asuna had decided to take up the cooking skill.

Time passed quickly for her as she cooked. Eventually, however, her table was laden down with various steaming dishes. Meat drizzled with juice, a pot of stew, strips of grilled meat... She had really gone all out this time.

Taking a seat at the table, Asuna inhaled deeply. Even the mere scent of the meat was enough to make her stomach grumble! Pulling the stew towards her, Asuna began to eat her feast, unaware of the reason why S-Class ingredients were so rare...

After a 3rd of the bottle was in her stomach she pulled back for air before proceeding to finish the rest of her meal. She continued in her cycle of eating and chugging, changing the meats to sugary treats and replacing her beers. She was beginning to feel her stomach expand, unused to this amount of food. "Fuck it". She muttered to herself. "I'm allowed a treat." She kept going and going until she realised with horror she had depleted most of her food stock that was meant to last her 4 days. Only a single cake remained in her inventory. The one she had been saving. Curiously she poked her now swollen tummy. It was tight like a beach ball. On the one hand she was concerned, on the other she was interested in how much more she could complete. She removed the party sized cake from her inventory, and hesitantly dug her fork into it without bothering to cut slices. She lifted it up to her mouth... It was amazing! Her swolleness was forgotten once more and she quickly devoured the entire thing! Only stopping to remove her dress as it had become less clothing and more of a restraint. It was a struggle even getting it over her belly. But now she was free and was licking the remaining icing off her fingers greedily. It was then she felt her now bare tummy bubble. She'd never eaten so much before! It ached so bad she had to lay down on the floor. Her swollen belly now sagging on it too in front of her. She rubbed it with her left hand, which pushed a monstrous *BURRRRP* from her esophagus. Her stomach bubbled again now, but more furiously. It had finally discovered a way to release all this gas and was perfectly happy to use it. Pushing up belch after belch getting deeper and larger. Lisbeth was sure if it didn't stop soon she'd not be able to breathe in time. But it did right as she was starting to see dark spots around her eyes and she lay there thankfully taking deep breaths. She wasn't sure how she felt about this gluttonous act of hers. But the belches did feel good.

155.content: How about we use you as the person interacting with the Characters of the story?
155.title: Even more.

1551.content:
In order to make as many people as possible happy with having themselves the main Character, (So to speak anyway.) let's use the second option from here on out for other people to use when they want to write their own in game Character bios. I'll start out with my own in game Character bio here.


Name: Zeig.


Age: 22.


Class: Assassin.


Alignment: Neutral-evil.


Skills and stats: Uses mostly skills that involve getting him from point A to point B as fast as possible, and without alerting the enemy to his presence. His stats are mostly focused around attack and speed. Allowing him to not only reach his destination ahead of schedule, but also to be the first one to attack when the need arises, and when the going gets tough enough for him to withdraw from the fray.


Equipment: Zeig travels light at all times so as not to be burdened by the wight of extra loot. He uses two daggers and a crossbow as his offense, combined with various types of herbs and/or poisons designed to either incapacitate, or assassinate the target victim. He also owns a sniper rifle, but he only ever uses it is when his target is too far away from the range of his crossbow.


Occupation: When he's not off killing other players/enemies, Zeig is busy helping out part time making clothing for a traveling caravan. And some of the clothing he makes he keeps as camouflage for use in future missions.


History since joining SAO: When Zeig realized that he and the other ten thousand gamers were trapped inside the Sword Art Online, he quickly realized that it was either kill, or be killed. It was nothing short of luck that he decided to use a assassin as his Character class as he was used to sneaking around and doing his own little thing. From staying on the sidelines and watching from afar, he was able to not only learn the rules of the game rather quickly, but also learned about the pros and cons of the other Character classes. And after he encountered a group of player killers, (Who failed to keep true to their name.) their leader offered him a job to work for him. Killing other players/enemies who get in his way, and paying Zeig more cash than he would ever earn working at the caravan in a month.
1551.title: Go in as myself.

15511.content:
"10,000?! Are you out of you damn mind?! What makes you think I'll pay you that much to begin with?!" It only took me a crossbow bolt with the tip coated with a very rare, and even more deadly poison pointed right at his jugular vein to give him the hint. Without so much as a word, he opened up his inventory and transferred the cash into my own inventory. Then ran as fast as his legs would let him.


"Heh. Another successful job." I looked at the time in my menu window and saw that it was almost 6:00 PM.


"And would you look at that. It's almost party time again. Don't want to be late this time." I then proceeded to make my way back into town.
15511.title: Play as Zeig.

choices: What time is it mister fox?
155111.content: I made my way back into town without error and proceeded to the inn. Along the way, many townsfolk (AI's and other players.) kept their distance upon seeing me walking down the streets. It wasn't because they knew who i was or what i did for a living. Not most of them anyway. But every player in SAO is given a gem that hovers above their heads, which tells the other players what kind of person they are, based on what color the gem is. If the gem is green, then it means you're a friendly player. If it's yellow, then it mean's you've committed a crime within three days. After three days have passed however, it turns back to being green. But if you've ever killed another player or players like i have, then it turns orange. And since everyone can see what color my gem is, everyone knows of the many sin's that I've committed. But even as they stay a good distance away from me, they still know that they're protected. So long as they remain within the safe zone inside the town, their HP will never fall below one. But if they ever run into me, or another PK outside of town, even if it's just a few feet away from the safe zone, they're pretty much screwed. Soon enough, i reach the inn and walk up to the front desk for my room key. The woman at the desk has her doubts about giving me my key, but she knows well enough that so long as i keep paying up, there's very little that she can do. With room key in hand, i make it to my room, lock the door, turn the lights off, and lie down for a quick nap.
155111.title: Proceed into town

1551111.content: I woke up right on time. Like always. I got up, grabbed my gear, and made my way through the window. Staying on the rooftops, i ran across them in the hopes that i could make the deadline for my next mission. Tonight, a convoy of well armed guards, said to be from the lead group, was to make camp on the 22nd floor. Which was the floor i was on right now. Their mission, to find a rare item that only spawns every three months. As much as i didn't like encountering the lead group, an item that only spawns every three months is well worth the risk. Making my way through the forest without encountering any obstacles, i soon see the camp up ahead, and duck down before anyone can see my approach. As i crawl to a large bush, i take a peek through it and see a bunch of players around a campfire. One of them catching my eye. A woman in a white outfit with a cape that went down to around her knees, and a red skirt. She had white socks that met her skirt and also had a red cross design at the top. She has long orange-brownish chestnut hair and hazel eyes. White shoes, and a rapier still in hilt on her left hip. No doubt she was in charge of this unit. One would take a quick look at her and say, i could take her. But if you've faced enough players like i have, it's that you never underestimate a player. While the monsters or other AI's have a code that they always have to follow, players on the other hand, are unpredictable. And can always surprise you. That's why i decided to wait things out and see what they were going to do first.
1551111.title: Midnight

15511111.content:
-Asuna's pov-


"Alright everyone. Listen up." Everyone looked up at me from the campfire waiting for me to speak up again.


"Our mission tonight is to locate an item of extreme value, said to be somewhere within this forest. It's said that the item only spawns once every three months. And that it only stays spawned for about five minutes. Then, it goes away until another three months have passed. We're here to find this item's spawn location before that happens, and return it to HQ. Any questions?" I saw a few show of hands before me. And pointed to one of them.


"Does anyone know what kind of item it is? I mean, it can't be some low level item, or there wouldn't be so many of us out here. Right Asuna?" I gave him a quick nod and responded.


"That's correct. The item in question has been identified as a new skill. What kind it is, we don't know. But as you all know, having extra skills is paramount if we're to complete the game and defeat the final boss on the 100th floor." All of the hands went down except for one.


"Has it been decided who gets to keep the skill?" After he spoke up, the other started talking amongst themselves. Thinking the same thing. If they were going to get it first. I had to think of something to calm them down and fast.


"While we still don't know who gets to keep the skill, our job is to bring it back to HQ and receive our pay. Which in case you were wondering, is to be divided amongst all of us evenly."


"And how much are we getting paid for this mission may i ask?" This came from the same man as before. Then i looked down at everyone and said-


"1.000.000." Then the campfire erupted in shouts of celebration of such a vast amount of wealth. While i was happy for such a large reward as well, i think they might have missed the part where we divide it all amongst ourselves. As the men kept raising their voices, i kicked one of them down into the other men beside him. Creating a domino effect. Knocking most of them down and giving them the hint.


"If you're all done talking, then it's time for us to search the forest for the spawn location. Move out!" Everyone got up and started loading up the supplies and putting out the campfire. Then i proceeded to move out as well.
15511111.title: Listen in without error

155111111.content:
"Damn. 1.000.000 huh? And a skill at that." I said to myself as the others started leaving.


"If i only have five minutes to find it, then I'd better move fast. And stay out of their sight." I then got up and bolted to the right through the trees. Searching for the spawn point as fast as i could before the others could find it first.
155111111.title: Returning to Zeig's pov

1551111112.content: As i ran through the forest, i soon came across a clearing with some sort of small ruin in the center. There were four pillars about five feet tall and two feet wide around a platform with a few steps a the base of it. Thinking i may have found the spawn point first, i waited for the item to appear, while keeping an eye out for the members of the lead group. Then, at 1:15 AM on the dot, a surge of energy came from the platform. Then a bright light. And then, the item appeared. And sure enough, it was a skill. Just as the lead group said it would be. I picked it up and added it to my own inventory. Eager to see what kind of skill it was, and if i could either use it, or sell it for the 1.000.000.
1551111112.title: Zeig finds it first

15511111121.content:
"Speed Demon." That was the name of the skill i just picked up.


"Stats...for one hour, attack and speed are.....doubled?! Now that is one hell of a skill!" Now i had my answer. This was a skill i could never sell. Not when my attack and speed were already over the top. As i moved my hand over the icon to use the skill and add it to my skill tree, i heard the sound of footsteps coming from behind me. No doubt the lead group still looking for the item in question. Before i could even think about making a run for it, the same woman from before came out of the thick of the woods to my left. Followed by some other men from the lead group.


"You there. Who are you, and what are you doing here?" The woman spoke up. I just turned to face her with my item window open and said-


"Why, I'm here for the same reason you're all here tonight. Though i have to say, I'm a little disappointed. I would have thought that the lead group would do a little better than what you've done so far." That's when the woman looked at my item window and saw the skill in my inventory.


"Is that...?!"


"The skill? Yes. It is. And you're a tad too late." Then i hit the use item button. And the skill was added to my own skill tree. Leaving the other solders to mope over the loss of their payday. Not that i couldn't help but mope a little myself. 1.000.000 is a lot of money. But the cash, loot, and battles i could win with this skill's power is well worth the sacrifice.


"Now then..."
15511111121.title: The speed demon

choices: A good day to kick back and relax
155111111212.content:
I put my right hand to my forehead and flicked it toward the group as a way of saying goodbye. Then ran off into the forest. For a moment, i thought i heard the sounds of people following me as i ran back to town, but soon heard nothing, and made my way back onto the rooftops and into my room without anyone noticing.


"Whew. What a night." I striped down to my undies and fell into my bed without a care in the world. Not covering up. Not even putting my legs into bed. I was that tired. The life of an assassin is truly a rough one. And it almost never gives you a brake. I've often times found myself not sleeping for over 72 hours just so i could catch that high value target off guard and rake in a truck load of money. Sometimes even longer. But after every job, i always find some time to relax, kick back, and take it easy for a little while. Perhaps tomorrow could be such a day.
155111111212.title: I must be off

choices: Arive at the cafe without error
1551111112122.content:
As the suns rays came through my open window, i slowly opened my eyes and got up.


"*Yawn*. What a night. But why does my bed feel so hard?" Then i looked down to see that i was on the floor. Must've fallen off in my sleep or something. I just shrugged it off, got up, and started getting dressed again.


"Wonder what i should do today?" Guess i could head over to the cafe and see if there's anything good left to eat." With destination in mind, i headed out to the front desk and left my key with the lady up front. Still unsure about harboring a PK. But it wasn't like she had a choice. So long as i kept tipping to owner anyway. As i left the hotel and walked down the many streets to the cafe, i didn't see many people out and about. It was very quiet. Something i wasn't used to in this part of town. Something was going on.
1551111112122.title: A good day to kick back and relax

15511111121221.content:
Whatever was going on today, it didn't seem to concern me. Not that i knew of anyway. Soon enough, i arrived at the cafe and took a window seat halfway down the isle. There was no one in here either, apart from a few voices i heard coming from one of the back rooms. Then, within moments, a young woman came out from the chiefs area holding some menus with a kind smile on her face and said-


"Hello! How may i be of ser-" Just then, she stopped mid sentience and saw the gem hovering over my head. Within seconds, that smile turned into a frown. Accompanied only by an icy glare that could melt said ice.


"I think I'll just have a menu if you don't mind." I said back with a kind smile of my own. Only for the lady to slam a menu down on top of the table and storm back off into the chiefs area.


"Hm. That's strange. She was surprisingly...nice to me this time around. Oh well. Don't let it bother you too much." I let out a small laugh as i opened up my menu and took a look at my options.

1552221.content:
Ever since New Aincrad had opened up Sakuya found herself, much like the other leaders, much, much more busy. The castle in the sky where the infamous deathgame took place was a popular site for SAO veterans and ALO players alike, many of whom were Sylphs in the current world.

Some among them were helpful in keeping the Sylphs in power as well as gaining money for the army. With her people doing welll and being in high spirits Sakuya decided one day to celebrate.

Taking her friends Alicia and Leafa, as well as Leafa's cousin Kirito and his girlfriend Asuna to a dinner party one day she and the others ate their fill and told old stories as well as new ones. Among them, Asuna had particularly good news.

"I decided to open up a restaurant in Aincrad." she had said. Recently the makers of the game had taken up a system similar to GGO where one could convert digital money into real money. Due to that Asuna could make a profit whilst practicing what she loved.

Of course Kirito and some of their friends already were going to help, but Sakuya saw a chance to help curry more of Kirito's favor.

Sakuya had decided to put up some of her own fund in order to help Asuna pay for the land and start up her business.

As thanks Asuna had given her free meals for life (technically speaking for as long as her player account existed).

It wasn't until later that Sakuya cashed in on it. That was when...
1552221.title: Heavy Duties for the Sylph Leader

choices: She manages to find Asuna's new cafe
Oh? She sees a familiar face!
15522211.content:
Sakuya landed on one of the main bridges connecting to New Aincrad, looking up at the majestic grand iron castle. Deep down, she could never have thought that a place of such grandeur and majesty be home to a death game that took the lives of over four thousand people.

Thankfully, she's in no death game. She is eager to see the new restaurant she invested her money into. Walking forward and past other players she opened up her menu as she saw a message ping.

She ignored the turned heads of some male players. The dark haired Sylph dealt with it ever since the old ALO's launch day, and she knew that it was probably the reason she was elected as the Sylph Faction leader on every voting cycle. Thank goodness for their sake she was a Student Council president in her high school days and majored in Law while abroad in the United States. It was how she came across MMOs in the first place, and on how she grew to love it.

All the while keeping her physique in check. Sakuya paled at the thought of becoming something like one of those otaku denegerates, both male and fujoshi. Thankfully, ALO had a secret diet solution that can impact her IRL.

While playing ALfheim Online, gamers still feel fatigue and hunger (even if their real bodies are not hungry), yet they can also eat in-game to dispel hunger in the real world, which has developed into a form of dieting for some people as a result. Sakuya intends to try this new form of dieting out. She approached the great blue warp gate and took a deep breath.

“Teleport. Floor 1. Town of Beginnings.” And she transported, winding up within the large city on the first Floor. Nice climate, no sign of rain or overcast. A pleasant day in-game indeed.

“Now…where was that place again?” She pondered outloud as she looked around the hustle and bustle of the city.
15522211.title: She was trying diet in real life and decided to...

choices: They went to see Leafa and order food.
They were approached by a male worker.
155222112.content:
To her surprise, Sakuya saw her friend and ally Alicia Rue, waving and approaching.

Alicia was one of the few friends that Sakuya knew both online and in real life. Though Alicia looked young, she was about Sakuya's age. The two had gone to the same school and served in the same student council. Whether it was as her in game self or as her real life one, Sakuya always felt happier to see her close friend.

"Hey, Sakuya. It's been a bit."

"Alicia, hi. What brings you to Aincrad?" Sakuya asked.

"Oh you know today's my day off so I figured it was time for me to visit this place. It really is beautiful." Alicia said as she looked at both the other players and the beautiful, simple scenery. "Can I ask why you're here?"

"I came to support Asuna's new cafe, and maybe say hi to Leafa. She's helping out there as well."

"Oh cool! Well I'll go on with you and maybe pick up a meal. To be honest I'm trying to limit all my extra eating to inside ALO. I've put on a few plans in real life." Alicia whispered, sweatdropping. Sakuya nodded to her.

"Well to be honest I have a good diet plan that goes along those lines. Come and eat with me and then we'll talk about it. Maybe I can help."

"I'd appreciate it alot." the blonde haired girl said as she went with her statuesque friend. The two of them continued to catch the glance of others in the area until they finally made it inside the restaurant. Once there they saw the place was already packed to the brim, with Leafa delivering the food trays to others along with Kirito.

The cafe was large, with six people to a table, mostly men gawking at Leafa or Asuna, or people clamoring for more food.

In the center was a dueling area for shows to be put on while players dined. There was an audience to watch people duel if the mood so struck them. Already some low level players were fighting, their beginner level blades clashing as a few of the diners cheered them on.

Smiling and feeling happy, Sakuya and Alicia barely noticed a new patch had been added to the game. They decided to look at it later, but for now...
155222112.title: Oh? She sees a familiar face!

choices: More talking between our ladies. Asuna and Kirito approach!
1552221121.content:
Sakuya and Alicia walked through the crowd as they took a seat over at a table for two. They saw their friend Leafa turn around and beamed, walking over.

"Hey you two! Welcome to Ragout Rabbit's Den!" Beamed the blonde Sylph. She was dressed in a waitress outfit reminiscent to ones wear by German waitresses, which revealed some cleavage from her modest bust. "So, how do you like this place?"

"It seems rather okay. I'm glad to see my investment has paid off," smiled Sakuya lightly. Alicia was leaning with her elbows on the table, chin on palms.

"And you look like you're having a good time workin' too Leafa! How's it like under Asuna?"

"Asuna is as good as a employer as I ever seen! Or had, as this is my first job in a sense." Leafa rubbed the back of her head sheepishly. "Good thing Ymir installed that new patch of the currency transfer!"

Ymir installed a new patch in New ALO where when you earn currency in-game, you can exchange it for real life currency, at a Yen to Yuld rate. Somehow, the one who made the idea and transplanted it in is in the talks for some economics award.

Suddenly a 'ping' rang out and Leafa's eyes shifted. "Oh! Someone else's order is ready! I'll have one of my co-workers handle your order, I have to take care of by business and what not."

Alicia's tail swished as she nodded. "Of course. Handle you shtick." Nodding, their blonde busty friend jogged off. Turning towards Sakuya, Alicia saw her deep in thought.

"Somethin' up? You are always thinkin' whenever you had that look on your face." Sakuya perked up, looking at Alicia.

"Ah. Nothing much. Just that...well...you know my birthday is in a month right?"

"Yeah? What about it?" Sakuya blushed a bit.

"I'm going to be 25..."

The threshold. The line of no return. If Sakuya does not have a significant other by that time then no would want to so much as 'touch her' in Japan. The 'Christmas Cake' urban legend and standard still held true.

"You really believe that?" Asked the Cait Sith with eyes quirked. "I never expected someone like you to be worried about boys. I always thought you swung the other way."

Sakuya looked flustered. "What! No! Just that...I have high standards for men is all. They need to the ability to look at 'me', not at-"

"Your boobies?"

"Quiet you."
1552221121.title: They went to see Leafa and order food.

choices: Leorin sends Sakuya complimentary ice cream
Leafa comes by to catch up as her shift has ended.
15522211211.content:
It didn't take long for the waiter to get to the girls once their conversation ended. PArt of Sakuya thought that all the people working would be other girls like Asuna and Leafa, but to her surprise a young man came over to her and Alicia.

"Hello ladies, welcome to Ragout Rabbit's Den. I'm Leorin." he said. Observing him, Sakuya was surprised to see that it was a Caith Sith like Alicia. He was tall and had creamy white skin, a flawless complexion. In addition to this he had bright, emerald green eyes. Like many Caith Sith's, his eyes were slittled and catlike. One fact about him that stood out though was his weight.

He was young and handsome, but overweight. He looked to be about in the range of the upper two hundred pounds, with a large belly emphasized by his fine looking and tight clothing that included a black tie and vest over his dress shirt. He had an air of gentle elegance about him despite his size, his chubby cheeks and slight triple chin giving him a friendly look.

Alicia smiled and looked at the menu before replying whilst Sakuya still observed him.

"I'll have the frenzy boar ham and mandrake fruit please." she said before smiling. "Ale to drink please."

"Alright, and you ma'am?" the man asked. Looking, Sakuya saw his name was Leorin.

"I'll have the, erm...Ragout stew please with a side of cream and bread." Sakuya said, still caught by the man's looks. Something about him just drew her eyes. When she was done ordering he took the menu and smiled.

"A lovely choice ma'am. I'll be back with your meals."

"Thank you Leorin." Sakuya said before he left, smiling. As Sakuya watched him leave she wondered who he was. Looking at Alicia she spoke. "Do you know him?"

"No. He's probably not into the race politics. I've met plenty of Cait Siths who've played for a while who don't even know who I am." Alicia said. "Still he does seem cute...Or at least you seem to think so."

"Hush!" Sakuya exclaimed, blushing before he came and gave them their food. As he handed them their food he smiled again.

"I hope you enjoy them. May I get your names...?"

"I'm Alicia, this is Sakuya. We're friends of Asuna and Leafa."

"Oh I see. Well they keep lovely company." he said, making Sakuya blush a bit more. "Let me know if you ladies need anything.

With that Leorin went back to the kitchen while Alicia giggled at her.

"Well, shall we enjoy our meals?" Alicia asked as she began to munch on the delicious ham. It was cooked to perfection and she sighed happily as the warm meat went down her gullet. Deciding to get on with her meal, Sakuya dined as well.

She began to slurp the delectably rare delight of a dish happily, dipping her cream slathered, warm bread into the broth. She had never tasted anythign so fine in real life.

Little did she realize the recent patch was a calorie calculator, meant to account for changes in physique for avatars. They could gain or lose weight, as well as musculature or scars from old battles if they so chose. Though this meant that excessive eating in game would cause change for the avatar.

Most players wouldn't notice though, because it was a low priority update. Mostly this meant fixing minor visual or programming details like different hues of leaves or detailing on buildings.

For now the two best friends continued to dine, until...
15522211211.title: Their waiter arrives!

choices: Sakuya called his voice, wanting to have more of a conversation
Leafa is off her shift and joins the duo.
155222112111.content:
Sakuya noticed out of the corner of her eye that Leorin was returning with two plates of...

"Oh! Ice cream!" Beamed Alicia, half way done with her own late-lunch. "But...we didn't exactly pay for this..." Leorin waved it off, the chubby blonde having a pleasant air around him.

"It's free. Complimentary from Asuna." He set them on the plate for the two. "She knows the two of you as great faction leaders, plus Sakuya gets her meals for free here as she invested in Asuna."

Alicia pouted. "I should have pooled my money when I had the chance..."

"You'll be fine. Spending a couple more Yuld won't kill you." Sakuya joked as she sipped at her soup with elegance.

"So!" Leorin clasped his hands together. "You want anything to drink? Want a refill?"

"Ummm..." Alicia pondered. "Refills are free right?"

"that they are!"

"One Mandrake Juice refill please!" Leorin picked up the catgirl's glass to refill. "Say~, how long have ya been in ALO?"

"Hmmm?" Leorin's ears twitched as he looked down at the much smaller Cait Sith. "Ymir run or RECTO run?"

"Oh? You played in the old ALO?" Asked Sakuya, dipping her bread in the soup for some extra flavor. "Launch day or afterwards?"

"Launch day. I got some grief from my parents for getting a VRMMO what with the SAO Incident, but I wanted to try it out first hand. My one gripe was the lack of leveling up. I...really don't care about an all PvP game like those MMBAs that was and still is all the rage. So I mainly stuck with leveling up my Beast taming, Holy, and Water Magic Skills. I got quite a few invites to play as heals."

"So you're a healer." Said Alicia, resting her head on her interlocked hands, smirking at the taller man. "Given your size I assumed you would be a big bad tank."

"I get that a lot. I mean, on other MMOs I played as tank, but I wanted to go for a change of pace, you know?"

"I understand the feeling," smiled Sakuya, finishing her meal and moving to her ice cream. As she picked up the spoon, a menu opened up in front of her. "Huh?"

"Morphius Ice Cream. When you touch it, you can have whatever flavor you want and a choice of 2 to 3 toppings."

"Seriously!" Said an astounded Alicia. "I'll pay it!" She opened her menu and exchanged some of her Yuld. "Man...virtual reality..." She pressed some buttons, her plain dull white dairy treat turning into a chocolate confection with whip cream, strawberries, and graham cracker powder. "Is the best!" She began to dig in, her ears perked with joy as she tasted the flavor.

"Here here!" Added Leorin. "I'll write your check Alicia-san." He bowed lightly towards his leader and then to Sakuya. "Sakuya-san." And he walked off to the back...
155222112111.title: Leorin sends Sakuya complimentary ice cream

1552221121112.content:
Leafa came over to the girls, back in her usual attire and smiling brightly as she took a seat.

"Sakuya, Alicia, it's good to see you both. How was the meal?"

"It was amazing. Asuna sure did agreat job."

"I'll let her know you liked it. One of the other workers made the ice cream personally though." Leafa said. "His cooking skill is pretty high."

"Really now? Well I think Asuna made a good choice. He's really well mannered, and Sakuya likes him."

After hearing Alicia, Sakuya cried out in shock. She was about to make an argument when Leafa spoke.

"Really now? He seemed to like her too."

"Now hold on a second, I nev-" she began when she realized what Leafa said. "...He does?"

"Yeah. I saw his face turn read and he asked me if I knew you when I went back to get more orders. It was kind of cute."

"Really? So a guy like that is into me?" Sakuya said, blushing when she realized he was likely one of those stereotypical nerds that she disliked. Though she really liked him she couldn't imagine him being like that, but what if he was? She had to know for sure.

As she continued to muse Alicia stacked up their empty dishes.

"He'll have to come back to get these, so we can find out for sure." Alicia teased more. "Though I might just order seconds. That food was too good to pass up."

"I have to agree, but I doubt they have any more ragout rabbit stew. After that I'd kill a dozen bosses for a few more servings of that stuff."

"Really? Well I heard a rumor that there was a ragout rabbit den. Maybe we could go there and bring some in. Even if we don't eat them we'd have tons of cash for it."

"True. I'm really glad they brought over SAO elements. It almost makes me wish we had been able to play." Sakuya said semi-seriously. Seeing what an impressive fighter Kirito and some of the SAO survivors were made her really admire what trials they had overcome. Even so she much prefered when games were simply games.

"Right, but for now I think I'm just happy I'm here in ALO. The best of both worlds."

"That's true as well." Sakuya said when she noticed Leorin.

Part of her wanted to pursue him, maybe ask about a friend request, but she couldn't help but wonder if he was really as charming in person. What if he disappointed her expectations? As shallow as it seemed Sakuya hoped he wasn't anything like people who's whole world was the game and the game alone.

Eventually she...
1552221121112.title: Leafa is off her shift and joins the duo.

choices: Alicia explains the Twin Realms Expansion
Someone else does instead. It's Kirito and Asuna!
15522211211121.content:
Sakuya stood up and walked over as Leorin finished taking an order. The tall plump man looked over, ears perked up. “Hmmm? Ah, hello there. Is there something you need?” He asked politely.

“Well…I was wondering…” Sakuya pondered over her worlds. “I was thinking that we could party up in the future. Taking on dungeons and so forth back in Alfheim, outside of Aincrad.”

Better than asking someone to go out. Asking for dungeon-crawling is much more preferable.

“Sure thing!” He grinned, opening his menu and asking for a friend request. Sakuya accepted. “So, I get off in about two hours. How long will you be online?”

“I have five or so hours. I will return back to Sylvain to run some things then we can meet at Arun.”

“Don’t trouble yourself,” Leorin waved, cat ears looking relaxed.. “I will fly to Sylvain myself.”

“Well, I will do my best to get a suitable group. What is your level?”

“45. You?”

Sakuya was a bit impressed. “28. As a faction leader I…don’t really have time to go out much. And if we do a Dungeon you won’t be able to get EXP due to my lower level and the dungeon you will be taking. I hope that’s not a problem right?”

“I can use some extra cash. And I’m high enough so my pet can tank it, so no need to worry Sakuya. I have to get back to work, so…” Leorin smiled. “See you then?”

“Yes. See you then Leorin.” She bowed lightly and walked back to the table. Leafa was a bit confused, whereas Alicia had that look on her face.

“You totally asked him out did you?”

“I did not,” Sakuya said in a calm level voice. “I only added him to friends. We’re going to a dungeon when he gets off of work.”

Alicia giggled. “Sounds like a date to me!”

The dark haired Sylph rolled her eyes. “Is not. You want to join the dungeon run too? You could use the leveling.”

“Eh, fair enough.” She leaned back and put her arms behind her head. “At level 25 I can use some leveling.” The Cait Sith leader looked over to Leafa. “Leafa-chan won’t need it. She’s only 10 levels away from the Cap!”

Leafa blushed. “I maybe level 90 right now, but it’s really thanks to Oni-chan’s and me joining in on the raids. We are at Floor 25 and we are capped already! And it’s only going to get harder too.”

“Hence the Expansion pack coming out soon right?” Alicia asked. “The Twin Realms expansion.”

“Twin Realms?” Asked Sakuya curiously. “Please forgive my lack of knowledge but…what does the expansion curtail?”
15522211211121.title: Approached him

choices: Sakuya prefers to stay...and they order something to pass the time

155222112111211.content:
"Okay, here is what is gonna be in the new Expansion," Alicia took a sip from her juice.

"First off, the namesake: the 'Twin Realms'. There will be two new zones, each half the size of Alfheim and separated North and South. To get to these new realms, you need to go through a specific portal. One in in Gnome territory, the other in Salamander territory. The one in Gnome territory takes you to the Land of Ice: Nifhelheim. The south portal, to Muspellheim, the Land of Fire."

"Fire and Ice?" Sounded Sakuya. "Sounds like that one popular book series made into a TV series..."

"More than 10 years later and STILL no Netflix or Hulu...HBO is a bunch of greedy goons," griped Leafa. This brought her wide eyed stares from her friends. "What? I like Game of Thrones."

"Anyways..." Alicia went back on topic. "In addition to those new realms: new items and weapons will be found, much more potent then even some higher level ones found in Alfheim and the lower levels of New Aincrad. In addition, the level cap will be raised from 100 to 135. It was originally supposed to be 120 but the developers who play this game and are with the clearing raids know how hard the Aincrad floors above 20 are so they raised the cap."

"I see...I take it these new realms will be around the 100s range?" Asked Sakuya. She needs to catch up badly! But her duties as faction leader are getting in the way!

"Supposedly." Alicia shrugged. "But for what it's worth I'm in the low ends as well. Only Leafa is near the cap to level up. We'd have to power level hard when we get the chance."

"I guess so..." The dark haired sylph ate at her ice cream as she turned towards the blonde Sylph. "Leafa, you wouldn't mind ummm...power leveling us when we have time right?"

"Sure thing!" Leafa beamed. "We'd need to grab a good heals, I know both you can me can heal but I can't last out in level 40-50 dungeons FOREVER." She chuckled.

Alicia got a cheeky cat-like grin as she turned towards a certain chubby Cait Sith taking another person's order. "I think I know a certain guy~. Plus, we could always ask Kirito, Asuna, and others to help!"

Sakuya shook her head. "It's best we stick to 4 members for a party, if we have too many the EXP would be spread too thin. So we have...us..." Her finger pointed towards everyone. "And Leorin." She turned towards Alicia. "How much longer until the Expansion is released?"

"About...two months?" Alicia pondered. "So, wanna do some farming on the lower Aincrad floors or head to Alfheim? Or, would you rather wait on Leorin here until his shift is over?"
155222112111211.title: Alicia explains the Twin Realms Expansion

choices: Leorin was nearby, training as well.
A ragout rabbit was nearby. It was time for a chase. Who knows where it'd lead.
1552221121112112.content:
"Sakuya, I need a heal over here!"

"Coming up." Sakuya said as she began to recite an incantation. The spell went to Alicia, healing her as she evaded a Drunken Ape's strike, attacking with a black magic spell while her Wyvern dealt with another two. Sakuya saw her friend and ally was close to leving up. "A couple more apes before we switch."

"Got it!" Alicia said as she jumped up, using a dagger she had on hand to deliver the finishing blow. It bumped her up to 30 after several hours of grinding. Smirking as she admired her new stat boosts, Alicia looked back at Sakuya who was standing at ready. "Switch!"

"Right!" Sakuya said, running forth, her Katana at ready for attack. Swiftly she began to attack the foes. She smirked, knowing that with her

Behind her Leafa was watching in case she needed to intervene for either of the others. So far the two leaders were doing well. Alicia smiled and then started to attack. Confident in her skills she was able to move about swiftly, evading their strikes with ease...And yet somehow she thought she was slower than usual.

Her speed was still great, but she felt heavier and less mobile. She couldn't place her finger on it, but she certainly wasn't quite as fast as she had been in the past. She figured it might be her profile lagging or somesuch, but she continued to fight, executing the last ape in a matter of minutes.

Exhausted from the combat, she sat down on a stump near Leafa, who was smiling.

"Good job. We can rest for a bit before we start again."

"Phew! Who knew cleared floors could still be so hard." she said as she looked to the charcoal black labyrinth of the eight floor. The large forest-like area reminded her of the raid where the Sylphs and Salamanders united to defeat the boss. She and Eugene had actually acted as a team in order to fight and overcome it.

Also the monsters of the area were transplanted from monsters of higher floors. The Drunken Apes were among said monsters. They were good for training and gave a good exp yield after the difficulty spike.

"I'll agree." Alicia said before sitting down. "I can't imagine how tough the higher floors will be..."

"Don't worry. It'll be a while before we get there. For now we can just take it easy. You two are making great pace."

"Thanks, but something is bugging me..." Sakuya said, looking down, contemplatively. When she did she could swear she had a bit of a belly. It was odd. She hadn't gained a pound in real life, yet her avatar seemed thicker, more full figured. Her clothes didn't feel tight on her avatar's body, but she could swear her face was chubbier, but her assets had also grown. Alicia seemed a bit larger too.

'But the avatars match our real weights, and mine hasn't changed at all...' she thought, wondering what exactly had brought such a thing on. That was when her belly rumbled again, embarassingly. Leafa looked at her and giggled.

"Well well, seems someone worked up an appetite. How about a lunch break?"

"Yeah, I'm starving." Alicia said, her long tail wiggling about as she thought of nourishment. Sakuya was feeling much the same.

"Well in that case I guess I could go for..." She began when she saw that......
1552221121112112.title: A Big Battle for the Guildleaders.

choices: Our trio head into the Floor's Town for some food
En route to the Town, they see Leorin out in the field...there's a monster!
15522211211121122.content:
"Is that..." Out of the corner of her eye Sakuya spotted the rare monster over by the trees. Slowly walking towards it, she gave a loud 'shhh!' to Leafa and Alicia. The Cait Sith and Sylph shrugged and turned back away. Sakuya will fill them in earlier.

Sakuya went over her skills. She could use her Wind Magic, but can it catch up to the critter and kill it? There is also her throwing weapon skill, but that was incredibly low, so she could easily miss and the rabbit would get away.

'Wing Magic it is.' She thought as she whispered the glowing arcane incantations. It was a simple Wind Spell that sent a slice of air pressure towards the target.

The Ragout Rabbit still munching on the shrubbery...not aware of Sakuya. Until it's ears perked up as Sakuya said the last syllable of the spell.

She released the spell, and the rabbit leaped...only to be sliced in half by the spell, giving out a cry before shattering into polygons.

And with a ping in her inventory, Sakuya inspected it and beamed.

One Ragout Rabbit's Meat was in her inventory with a durability of 5 in-game days before it goes rotten and disappears. That is plenty of time!

"Oui Sakuya," Alica jogged up to the taller Sylph. "Whatcha got?" She asked, seeing the look of amusement of delight on the dark haired Sylph's face.

"Oh nothing, just an incredibly rare item that I could sell for over one hundred yuld."

"Don't tell me!" Alicia gasped. "You got some super rare item from a low level mob!"

Sakuya nodded, placing a hand on her softer hips. "Indeed. One Ragout Rabbit's Meat."

"My big brother got that back in his SAO days!" Leafa said in surprise. She then beamed a little. "It was the very meat that bonded him and Asuna together. After all, a man to a man's heart is through his stomach."

"I can adhere to that!" Added the Cait Sith with a giggle. "My dad was always a bit heavyset, but my mom managed to nab him because of said cooking," She then turned towards Sakuya, once again with that cat like look on her visage. "Got someone in mind to give it Saku-nyan? Hmmm~?"

Sakuya blushed a bit. "M-Maybe, but only because my own cooking skill is rather low! I have no use for it and I have enough Yuld already."

"Dude," Alicia said. "Over one hundred grand here is like, one hundred yen IRL. That can get ya some nice stuff. You sure on this?"

As soon as Alicia finished her sentence, the round of growling rang out. And it wasn't just from Alicia and Sakuya's stomachs, but also Leafa as well.

The blonde sylph laughed. "Yeah...had breakfast at like, 5 a.m. this morning due to my Kendo practices. Want to nab some lunch at one of the towns?"

Sakuya nodded, with Alicia giving her approval. "Say no more. All this grinding as left me hungry!"
